org.jtrim.image.transform

Class ZoomToFitTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.ZoomToFitTransformer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jtrim.concurrent.async.DataConverter<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImage>, ImageTransformer

    public final class ZoomToFitTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageTransformer
    Defines an ImageTransformer scaling an image to fit the display.

    Special cases:

    • If neither FIT_WIDTH, nor FIT_HEIGHT is specified, then the image is not scaled (i.e., the applied zoom property is 1.0).
    • If exactly one of FIT_WIDTH and FIT_HEIGHT is specified, then the aspect ratio is honored unless the absence of MAY_MAGNIFY requires that the applied zoomX or zoomY must not exceed 1.0.
    • If MAY_MAGNIFY is not specified, then neither the applied zoomX, nor the zoomY can be greater than 1.0. They will be reduced accordingly (if KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO is not set, then only the offending one will be reduced to 1.0).

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.
    See Also:
    getBasicTransformations

    • Constructor Detail

      • ZoomToFitTransformer

        public ZoomToFitTransformer(BasicImageTransformations transBase,
                    java.util.Set<ZoomToFitOption> options,
                    java.awt.Color bckgColor,
                    InterpolationType interpolationType)
        Creates a new ZoomToFitTransformer with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        transBase - the additional transformations to be applied to the source image. The scaling and offset property of this BasicImageTransformations are ignored. This argument cannot be null.
        options - the rules to be applied for scaling the image. This argument and its elements cannot be null. The content of this set is copied and no reference to the set will be kept by the newly created instance.
        bckgColor - the Color to set the pixels of the destination image to where no pixels of the source image are transformed. This argument cannot be null.
        interpolationType - the interpolation algorithm to be used when transforming the source image. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • Method Detail

      • getBasicTransformations

        public static BasicImageTransformations getBasicTransformations(int srcWidth,
                                                int srcHeight,
                                                int destWidth,
                                                int destHeight,
                                                java.util.Set<ZoomToFitOption> options,
                                                BasicImageTransformations transBase)
        Returns the image transformations required to be applied to an image to fit a display with the particular size. The transformation assumes that (0, 0) offset means, that the center of the image is displayed at the center of the display.

        Special cases: See the class definition for special cases of the zoom to fit options.

        Note that ZoomToFitTransformer will use the transformation returned by this method, so you may use this method to check what transformation would the transformation use.

        Parameters:
        srcWidth - the width of the image to be scaled to fit the display. If this argument is less or equal to zero, an identity transformation is returned.
        srcHeight - the height of the image to be scaled to fit the display. If this argument is less or equal to zero, an identity transformation is returned.
        destWidth - the width of display, the source image needs to fit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        destHeight - the height of display, the source image needs to fit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        options - the rules to be applied for scaling the image. This argument cannot be null.
        transBase - the additional transformations to be applied to the source image. The scaling and offset property of this BasicImageTransformations are ignored. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the image transformations required to be applied to an image to fit a display with the particular size. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified destination width or height is less than zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null
